page.title: 19FRANK MONTGOMERY SCHOOL
page.content: The Frank Montgomery School is a mixed secondary modern school, situated in Bredlands Lane on the A28 Canterbury to Margate road, north of Westbere. The school was opened on the 1st of July,1935 as the first central school in Kent and this year celebrates its Golden Jubilee. The Head Teacher is Miss Betty Chapman.There are 43 teachers and 760 pupils.The school has 12 governers, one of whom, Mrs Hazel McCabe, is the Mayor of Canterbury. We are highlighting 2 problems facing the school.{1.TRANSPORT}. The school's pupils come from the outlying villages.Nearly 50% of these come from nearby Sturry & Hersden so they walk, cycle or get lifts. The others come from awide catchment area which extends to Bishopsbourne, Wickhambreux & Hoath
